unnormalised: ## EV Charging: No More Range Anxiety, Yaar!
normalised: E V Charging: No More Range Anxiety, Yaar!

unnormalised: Okay, so you're thinking about ditching your trusty Maruti for an electric ride? Welcome to the club! But let's be honest, the first thing that pops into everyone's head is: charging. Where do I charge? How long will it take? Will I get stranded halfway to Bengaluru?
normalised: Okay, so you're thinking about ditching your trusty Maruti for an electric ride? Welcome to the club! But let's be honest, the first thing that pops into everyone's head is: charging. Where do I charge? How long will it take? Will I get stranded halfway to Bengaluru?

unnormalised: Well, chill, my friend. EV charging in India is evolving faster than you can say "paneer tikka." It's not as scary as it seems.
normalised: Well, chill, my friend. E V charging in India is evolving faster than you can say "paneer tikka." It's not as scary as it seems.

unnormalised: First up, home charging. This is your best bet for daily drivers. Think of it like charging your phone overnight. Plug in, go to sleep, and wake up with a full "tank." You can get a standard charger installed at home for maybe Rs. 15,000- Rs. 25,000.
normalised: First up, home charging. This is your best bet for daily drivers. Think of it like charging your phone overnight. Plug in, go to sleep, and wake up with a full "tank." You can get a standard charger installed at home for maybe rupee fifteen thousand to rupee twenty five thousand.

unnormalised: Then there are public charging stations. These are popping up everywhere, from petrol pumps (ironic, right?) to malls to even some kirana stores! Companies like Tata Power and Ather are setting up networks all over the place. You can use apps to find them, just like finding the best biryani joint in Hyderabad.
normalised: Then there are public charging stations. These are popping up everywhere, from petrol pumps (ironic, right?) to malls to even some kirana stores! Companies like Tata Power and Ather are setting up networks all over the place. You can use apps to find them, just like finding the best biryani joint in Hyderabad.

unnormalised: Charging speed depends on the charger. Slow charging (like at home) might take 6-8 hours for a full charge. Fast charging can juice you up to 80% in about 1-2 hours. That's enough time to grab a chai and samosa while you wait.
normalised: Charging speed depends on the charger. Slow charging (like at home) might take six to eight hours for a full charge. Fast charging can juice you up to eighty percent in about one to two hours. That's enough time to grab a chai and samosa while you wait.

unnormalised: Speaking of road trips, range anxiety is real, but it's getting better. Most modern EVs offer a range of 200-400 km on a single charge. Plan your route, find charging stations along the way, and you're good to go. Maybe even stop for some Onam Sadhya on the way if you're headed south!
normalised: Speaking of road trips, range anxiety is real, but it's getting better. Most modern E Vs offer a range of two hundred to four hundred kilometer on a single charge. Plan your route, find charging stations along the way, and you're good to go. Maybe even stop for some Onam Sadhya on the way if you're headed south!

unnormalised: The government is also pushing for more charging infrastructure, so expect things to improve rapidly in the coming years. Places like IIT Madras are doing some amazing research on battery tech, too!
normalised: The government is also pushing for more charging infrastructure, so expect things to improve rapidly in the coming years. Places like I I T Madras are doing some amazing research on battery tech, too!

unnormalised: So, don't let charging be the reason you're holding back from going electric. Do your research, plan ahead, and embrace the future, boss! Happy driving!
normalised: So, don't let charging be the reason you're holding back from going electric. Do your research, plan ahead, and embrace the future, boss! Happy driving!
